Berrien County Juvenile Center
6414 Deans Hill Road
Berrien Center, MI 49102
Dear Mr. Dama:
This letter is a follow-up to the Department’s findings regarding the interim inspection
conducted at your facility on 07/15/2021. The purpose of this inspection was to determine
compliance with applicable licensing statutes and administrative rules for Court Operated
Residential Care Facility.
Your facility was found to be in compliance with the requirements of Act No. 218 of the
Public Acts of 1979, as amended, Act No. 258 of the Public Acts of 1974, as amended,
and the applicable Administrative Rules.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility submitted one approved corrective action plans during this review period.
This CAP was in regard to the special investigation 2021C0212007 with an approved
CAP on 3/30/21. The violation of this special investigation involved rule 400.10175
(Resident confinement room) when staff did not complete the required room checks on
two youth in room isolation. The facility did have surveillance footage to show the youth
were being supervised, the staff did not document the room checks as required in this
rule. The approved CAP involved the facility adding room checks to the training
calendar and lesson plans to ensure all staff are made aware of the need for
documented room checks when a youth is in their room. The facility will conduct twice
yearly training on this issue and compliance will review room checks daily. A review of
these daily room checks was conducted during this inspection and the facility is
611 W. OTTAWA  P.O. BOX 30664  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/lara  517-335-1980

following through as described in the CAP. A review of staff training logs also support
that the facility is following through with the CAP.
Six restraint reports were reviewed, and it was documented that the staff followed the
facility policy/procedures for taking this action. Six seclusion reports were reviewed and
again, the facility staff followed the policy/procedures when a youth was placed in
seclusion.
Numerous staff were interviewed, and this included administration staff to direct care
staff. All staff indicated a desire to use best practice when providing treatment to the
youth in care. The direct care staff indicated that they believed the administration was
open to listening to their concerns and providing the best care for youth. They also
reported a belief that administration was supportive of their personal growth and ability
to provide care for the youth in care. All staff interviewed report adjusting to the changes
made for COVID-19 and having administration provide the appropriate items to keep
staff and youth safe.
Consultation was provided when the facility shared that not all staff are following
through with the changes brought about by the recent CAP. They reported room checks
are being made and documented as stated in policy/procedure, however they are trying
to add these room checks with details to the seclusion reports. Because this is a new
change, it is not occurring at an appropriate compliance rate. They will add this to the
over-night assistance supervisor’s check list of items to review each night.
Please contact me with any questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need
to speak to someone immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area
manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
July 16, 2021
Paul Fatato
